description:
Vibrio parahaemolyticus RIMD 2210633 is a strain of the bacterium Vibrio parahaemolyticus, which is a Gram-negative, curved, rod-shaped, and facultatively anaerobic organism. This particular strain was isolated in Japan and has been widely studied due to its pathogenic potential.

Vibrio parahaemolyticus is an important foodborne pathogen known to cause gastroenteritis, often associated with the consumption of raw or undercooked seafood. The RIMD 2210633 strain possesses several virulence factors, including thermostable direct hemolysin (TDH) and TDH-related hemolysin (TRH), which contribute to its ability to cause disease in humans.

The genome of Vibrio parahaemolyticus RIMD 2210633 has been sequenced, providing insights into its genetic makeup and potential mechanisms of pathogenicity. This strain has been used as a model organism for studying the biology, epidemiology, and host-pathogen interactions of Vibrio parahaemolyticus, which remains an important public health concern in many parts of the world.
